name: Sarova Mara Game Camp

reviews.text: Best part of the lodge was being woken up nightly by the roaring of the local lions!!! They had an electric fence so you did not have to be escorted. They did have dik-diks and baboons wandering around so just be alert.
reviews.title: Who knew a tent could be so comfy!

reviews.text: The property was spread out. Most tents were side-by-side with a walkway between them in groups of two. If you have trouble walking then you should request a higher number tent as the lower numbers are at the other end of the property. If you have a large group ask for the family tent... two tents in the same area with a communal area of 2 couches and a table for 4.
reviews.title: Luxury Safari.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was mostly the bed, desk and bath. The toilet is separate from the shower/sink area. You are given toiletries and 2 bottles of water a day. Electricity did go off at night but you are given a torch/flashlight.
reviews.title: Wow it really is that good

reviews.text: Great food/bar area and the food choices were basic but there were several options. If you could not eat anything they made they would offer to make you something special.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in sarova mara

reviews.text: Staff was friendly, attentive and so willing to share information about their country, their tribes and themselves.
reviews.title: Great Experience in Masai

reviews.text: Expansive hotel, where rooms are arranged in very confortable 'tents' with fully functioning bathrooms including hot-water showers -- greatly appreciated after a dusty safari run.
reviews.title: Lovin the tents

reviews.text: The staff were really attentive. Aside from an isolated incident with the greeter at the restaurant, the rest of the staff was special. The Spa lady needs to be commended.
reviews.title: Beyond all our expectations. Will go back very soon.

reviews.text: You can tell this hotel has been around for a while, very organized, grounds lushly landscapped. Even then though, it does not nor feel tired/worn nor Disney-safari like.
reviews.title: Surpassed all our expectations!

reviews.text: I was afraid of the quality of the food given that this hotel tends to cater groups or people on set tours. All in all, while not 5* I was pleasantly surprised about both the variety and quality of it all. They always had local Kenyan dishes to try which is great !!
reviews.title: TOP CLASS STAY,excellent stay yet again,will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the most exiting destination for us for several reasons. The service by all the staff from the most junior to the most senior was uniform in being of very high class and it was clear that agreat deal of time and effort has been put in ensuring that ALL the staff work in perfect harmony! I cannot remember a time when I have been to a hotel and left with such a high impression.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: We (mine and my cousin's family) stayed at Sarova Mara on 1st & 2nd of July 2011 before moving to Lake Nakuru to stay at Sarova Lion Hill.
reviews.title: Wonderful.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To talk about Sarova Mara, its nothing short of a dream for all of us.....
reviews.title: The Best of 3 Safaris!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Wonderful weather - 12 to 15d at night and about 25d during day (we went from Dubai where the weather is about 40+)
reviews.title: Really nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Wonderful hospitality
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: - Excellent property / camp
reviews.title: Superb Luxury Tents
An amazing experience
reviews.text: Pros
- Beautiful scenery and landscape
reviews.title: Our most memorable Holiday

reviews.text: - Right at the tip of Masai Mara, which is at the heart of the annual animal migration
reviews.title: We definitely will arrange another holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Beautifully appointed tents but with all the comforts of an indoor hotel room
reviews.title: Nice and comfortable hotel

reviews.text: - Very comfortable bed with hot water warmers placed during turndown
reviews.title: Loved the tents!

aka: Sarova Mara Game Camp Hotel Maasai Mara National Reserve
description: Nothing quite captures the true spirit of East Africa, like a safari in Kenya’s richest game reserve, the Maasai Mara. Sarova Mara Game Camp offers front seats to nature’s most breathtaking show - the wildebeest migration. The endless plains of East Africa are the setting for the world’s greatest wildlife spectacle where, from the vast Serengeti plains to the champagne colored hills of Kenya’s Maasai Mara, over 1.4 million wildebeest and 200,000 zebra and gazelle, relentlessly tracked by Africa’s great predators, migrate in a clockwise fashion over 1,800 miles each year in search of rain ripened grass. Sarova Mara Game Camp is well positioned to enjoy this unique phenomenon. The rolling plains around the Camp are teeming with wildebeest, gazelles and zebras, during the migration months and the Camp is situated right in the center of their migration path. Sarova Mara Game Camp is also the ideal choice for those seeking a richer experience of Maasai Mara that goes much beyond just game drives. By virtue of its location and layout, the Camp offers an unparalleled plethora of activities and experiences from luxury tented living to bird-watching, mini golf, sport fishing and a unique insight into the Maasai culture at the adjoining Maasai village.
